title: Performance Marketing Specialist
content:
About Us
Avea is a Swiss longevity startup with the vision to become the leading player in the evidence-based longevity supplement industry. We offer science-based longevity supplements to target multiple hallmarks of ageing, allowing individuals to improve their well-being by slowing down ageing itself. Our mission is to optimise peopleâ€™s health- and lifespan, helping them keep or regain their vitality to live as healthily as possible for as long as possible. 
As a Performance Marketing Specialist, you will be responsible for initiating, executing, and reporting on digital marketing initiatives to drive awareness and conversions. You will set the strategy, optimise our existing performance channels, test new channels, and own the results in our primary markets. 
As our Performance Marketing Specialist your responsibilities are:

Drive our digital performance marketing across all channels e.g Meta, Google and TikTok 
Plan and set up online marketing campaigns in coordination with the Co-Founder in charge of marketing
Monitor performance of individual assets (e.g. pictures, articles, videos), identify what works best  and coordinate with the rest of the marketing team to produce more high performance assets and to implement best practices
Measure and analysis campaigns on a daily basis by using Google Analytics, Google data studio, Google Ads Dashboard & Facebook Ads Dashboard, Excel and other dashboards needed.
Identify improvement opportunities in digital performance marketing growth and efficiency by constantly testing ideas with audience targeting, split tests and A/B tests etc.
Test new channels and opportunities

Your qualifications:

University degree in quantitative majors such as engineering, physics, or mathematics is strongly preferred
Data-driven mindset: you are analytical, enjoy examining data, and can draw conclusions from it
Previous experience in paid performance (Meta & Google) for E-commerce are needed
You're a team player capable of working independently in a dynamic work environment that demands individual initiative and problem-solving skills
Eager to learn and adopt new tools/technologies as well as share knowledge with others
Very good command of Ms.Excel 
Familiarity with online shopping and experience in optimizing the conversion journey and online customer acquisition
Minimum of 1-year experience with either the Google AdWords platform or Facebook Ads Manager, ideally both
Experience in data management (preferably Tableau) is an advantage 
A basic understanding of Google Analytics is required; certification is advantageous
Interest in the longevity industry 

Why join us
We believe that the best companies help you live your life the way you want and become the person you want to be. That's why we focus on promoting your personal freedom and growth. As a member of our team, you'll enjoy:

Working at a well-funded, early-stage startup in the longevity industry.
Being part of a dynamic, high-performing, and fun team.
A high degree of personal responsibility, creative freedom, and opportunities.
Collaborating with the brightest researchers in the longevity field and with successful and renowned serial entrepreneurs.
Fully remote opportunities with home office support.
Unlimited holidays and flexible working hours.
Education allowance and accelerated growth paths.
Complimentary products and discounts for family & friends.
A strong team culture with regular team events and off-sites.

Join us as we shape the emerging longevity space, fostering healthier, longer lives!

Data Privacy Statement

When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Maximon AG (“Controller”), which is located at Bahnhofplatz, 6300 Zug and can be contacted by emailing careers@maximon.com. Controller’s data protection officer is Ildiko Sirman, who can be contacted at contact@maximon.com. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Controller’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment. 

Your personal data will be shared with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Controller to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Controller’s behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site. Because the European Union Commission has determined that United States data privacy laws do not ensure an adequate level of protection for personal data collected from EU data subjects, the transfer will be subject to appropriate additional safeguards under a Data Processing Agreement. You can obtain a copy of the standard contractual clauses by contacting us at careers@maximon.com.

We strive to recruit the best international talents of today and tomorrow and therefore want to maintain a high-profile talent pool (“Talent Pool”). The Talent Pool is an accumulation of candidate profiles that we have identified to have a relevant skill set and may be considered for other open positions at Maximon. You hereby accept that your profile will be added to the Talent Pool of Maximon after the application period has closed, and used to possibly contact you later, if you should be considered for another post. Your profile will be kept in the Talent Pool for a maximum of two years. Your profile will be removed if you explicitly request the deletion of your personal data. You may submit the deletion request to the HR Department of Maximon.

Maximon also provides email updates for candidates about what Maximon and their portfolio companies are doing in the Longevity space. Maximon uses the service provider Gmail and Mailchimp for the purpose of providing this service. You hereby accept that your email address will also be shared and stored by Mailchimp. 

Under the GDPR, you have the right to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. You also have the right to data portability. In addition, you may lodge a complaint with an EU supervisory authority.
